website_summaries.verdict: With an attractive design, long battery life, and solid performance for the price, the $150 Motorola Moto e is one of the best affordable phones you can buy.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Budget Phone - read this if you need dual-sim
customer_reviews.text: Another solid Moto G. Only negative so far is you can't have two sims and a memory card. It's EITHER dual-sim / no memory card OR single-sim / memory card.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G

customer_reviews.title: Good phone, rubbish service
customer_reviews.text: Phone is great but Amazon did not apply £10 voucher and after half an hour on the phone said they would escalate this so id get a refund voucher but I've heard nothing since.
customer_reviews.author: Read this before buying!!

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Mid Ranged Phone
customer_reviews.text: A phone that's not going to break the bank with tons of features. Fast and nice looking. Really clear and large display. Fantastic cameras. Tons of storage. Really can't do better at this price. Wireless charging would have been a nice extra but you can't have everything. Great Phone.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Nice improvement from my Moto G5
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life and nice 6.3 inch screen. Love the face recognition to wake up screen. However been having problems with this new phone recognising my finger prints. My old Moto G5 had no problems. Shame as some of my banking apps, PayPal eBay etc can use finger print login, if working correctly. I hope Motorola fix this issue soon. Otherwise very happy with this phone. As of early February, still problems with fingerprint sensor.
customer_reviews.author: mjcmoppel

customer_reviews.title: Random restarts, Lenovo won't address problem
customer_reviews.text: Phone keeps restarting, quite annoying in the middle of the night! One day in restarted 5 times for me. As mentioned by another reviewer, there is a thread on the Lenovo/Motorola forum about this - but the Forum went into read only mode on 7th of January. The security patch for this phone is dated September 2019. It's a shame really, as this a great phone. But i can't recommend it in case you get one like mine that is unuasble. I have returned the phone to Amazon due to lack of response from Lenovo. A far cry from when Google owned Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Faulty - turns itself off
customer_reviews.text: A frequent purchaser of Moto G's (4 models to date, all of which I was very happy with), this has been the most disappointing so far due to a recurring fault. The phone regularly turns itself off when idle resulting in missed notifications, calls, messages, etc... I have gone through online boards, 2 rounds of amazon support, 1 round of Motorola support, and finally had to send the phone away for repair. I have currently been without it for 12 days and counting, which is very frustrating when I don't have an adequate spare (hence the reason for buying it in the first place)
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a new phone but not planning to buy immediately, but this came up on a 'deal of the day' for £192. Upgraded from Moto X style due to battery. I had to recharge twice a day, but it was over 3 years old. Moto g8 plus is lasting 2 days easily between charges and is noticeably faster at loading apps and web pages. Fingerprint sensor is fast and screen is brighter. Used the camera at night to take photos at a Christmas lights event. Pictures were good in night mode.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Brown

customer_reviews.title: Unexplained shutdowns and screen freezing
customer_reviews.text: For some reason if you have a product problem you are referred to the forum site to find a solution. The phone shuts down a lot without anyone touching it, also periods of non screen operation as if its frozen. Not something I would expect from any phone in its first month of limited useage.
customer_reviews.author: Buddhaxg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone compromised by poor quality control.
customer_reviews.text: The device suffers from frequent random reboots daily. I'd say up to about 20 per day. It appears to be an issue when the phone idles (i.e. screen off, little activity). In essence the phone, when running is excellent but it's completely unstable. Not sure if this is a widespread problem across the model or limited to a specific batch, but it clearly identifies Lenovo's quality control as severely lacking. My handset went back for repair after 1 month, and others have reported the issue in Lenovo's supoort forums. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Does not support SD Card Encryption
customer_reviews.text: While the specs and the price of the phone are good, it does not provide the option to encrypt the SD Card, which means the SD Card reader is practically useless, as any meaningful use would allow a thief to access my personal data. If you value your privacy and the security of your data (e.g. if you use your phone to quickly capture documents containing important information to you, e.g. your passport, car/health insurance documents, etc), I think you should look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Nikos

customer_reviews.title: Superb Budget Phone
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the MOTO g8Plus, I came from an iPhone 7 expecting a poor quality product but I'm shocked at how good it is, Faster than the iPhone, better camera and far superior battery life. Nice plain android which is fast and smooth. The build quality feels cheap compared to Apple but put it in a Spigen case and it feel like a premium product now. Easily best budget phone 2019.
customer_reviews.author: Roy P.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value for money - another great device from Motorola
customer_reviews.text: Another great phone from Motorola. Fantastic battery, clean Android experience with the additional Motorola features (moto actions) that are incredibly convenient and useful. Camera has always been Motorola's weakness but this has improved significantly in my opinion. Comparing to Honor/Huawei (my previous handset) camera is still not there performance wise, however the app and operating system stability is superb for this price point. Battery is in a completely different league from other devices and processing performance (gaming experience) is quite adequate. To sum it up - very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Arunas Janusis

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built and clean OS. Quick and great camera. Good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect updates!
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day all the time. Lovely phone and it does everything I need. However, it was promised that these phone would get upgraded to Android 10 - wrong! They have never been updated and there is no sign they will be, quite the opposite now. Wouldn't buy this brand of phone again which is a shame. On a plus, the manufacturer does not insist on ramming all their software (bloatware) on to their phones unlike Samsung and the such like, so the phone always runs smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Failed less than 2 months from brand new! Useless.
customer_reviews.text: Brand new purchase but this phone has stopped working after only 50 days of use. Not recommended. Update: sent for repair under the warranty. The repair took 2 weeks. Motorola declined to offer any compensation for loss of use. If you must buy this phone buy it from John Lewis: unlike Amazon if the phone is faulty they will exchange it for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: E.C.

customer_reviews.title: I like the phone but it has an annoyance
customer_reviews.text: Nice phone if your usage demands are met by the reasonably good spec. However, the phone annoyingly spontaneously reboots a couple of times a day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: very disappointed with this Moto G8 Plus phone which replaced a Moto G5 Plus which was a great phone. Cons: Very average battery life about one day on low to moderate use. Very long charging time. Laggy when opening apps or news articles. Although a bigger phone seems bulkier than the G5 Plus. Phone goes into hold mode during phone calls ( main reason I upgraded from G5 Plus) Pros: Good screen colours and definition. Bigger screen. Good volume from speakers Not good value for money and this will be my last Motorola phone.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice fast cheap smartphone
customer_reviews.text: Nice budget smart phone with good performance and great camera.. bought it for my wife ..it's so much better than her ageing Moto G4 in low light and the focusing is much much faster.... for even more control use "open camera" from the play store ..the screen is really nice and clear ... battery easily lasts all day with fairly heavy FB/YT use . Can't comment on the included charger as we have 2 4 port chargers and it charges nice and quick.. We've always loved the fairly close to vanilla android experience you get with the Moto g series ..no bloatware like Sony & Samsung..you add the apps you want and don't have any unwanted apps you don't want.
customer_reviews.author: getyerspn

customer_reviews.title: Moto G is again the best budget phones.
customer_reviews.text: The Moto G8 range are the best budget phones consistently each year. There are a few to choose from and I have the PRO. I chose the Pro because it has NFC and 5ghz WiFi as I want to pay my shopping contactless and play Xbox Xcloud at home. My wife has the power lite as it has a bigger battery and was much cheeper but lacks both NFC and faster WiFi. Look at the Moto G8 range to find the one that meets your needs best. MOTO G8 PRO. PROS: Build quality. Camera. NFC. 5ghz WiFi. No bloat ware. CONS: Heavy. Battery life.
customer_reviews.author: large crane

customer_reviews.title: Good average, does what I need adequatly
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a high end product but will probably meet all of most peoples needs. I've had a G6 and G4 in the past and upgrade every other version (approx. 2 yrs). Wife has G7 (G5 & G3 before). We haven't had any major issues in any of these as they work adequately and seem reasonably well built for a 'budget' phone. We pass on our previous phones to family members as they are still functioning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value phone, but not if you regularly play Zynga's Words with Friends
customer_reviews.text: My Samsung S7 gave up and I was looking for a replacement that didn't cost too much and had a reasonably good camera. I also wanted bloat free android. After a couple weeks of use I can't really comment on the camera but it seems to tick most boxes. The one annoyance is that display sizing for Words with Friends game is absolute *hit. No sign of Zynga rectifying this and no response from them. If you are a heavy user beware. Overall however I am pleased and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone
customer_reviews.text: Amazing phone, it makes you wonder why people, including me pay so much for Huawei's and Samsung's. This has been a little gem so far. I purchased for my wife to replace a Huawei P10 she has had some time now and to be honest I cannot fault it in any way. Battery life is amazing, screen is very clear and responsiveness is excellent. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jason D.

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best budget phone on the market
customer_reviews.text: Good phone, as it has a biggish battery, it's slightly on the thick side but that's a big deal. Screen is good. Not that bright at 50% though. You can do wifi calling, has nfc and the camera is really good. Takes good pics with autofocus and zoomed pics are too heavily distorted. Compared to my Samsung a70, the camera is way better than that Overall I think it's a very good budget smart phone. It does wifi calling .... That's quite good for a 200quid smart phone. (That's how much I paid)
customer_reviews.author: Kray-Z

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone for 6months now. I'm really happy with it, it's just brilliant. It has most of the features other top of the range phones have. The battery was amazing but have noticed it now need to charge more often but maybe it's because i use it more and have more appts on now. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: My 3rd Motorola in a row. Not disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful that Lenovo are still keeping the Motorola phone's at sensible price, I'll not be using phones from our Korean friends again, given the silly high prices they command. Dual SIM works well at the expense of losing memory card function, camera is the best phone camera I've had to date, especially the low light capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. J. Tsu

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a 2013 Xperia Z, so the G8 plus seems very quick and responsive with a huge screen. Therefore not really comparing to other more modern devices. Battery life seems great easily over a day even trying for 20-80%, and charges very quickly. Bought in Xmas deal so fab value on what already seems like a good deal! Not really had long enough to comment on build quality etc. Hoping Motorola keep their promise of 2 years of updates!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget phone.
customer_reviews.text: Always been a fan of the Moto G plus range, but this has better battery life and also a compass, which was missing in previous models.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lewis

customer_reviews.title: G8 Plus 7/10
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd Motorola phone and in many ways the best just let down with a few niggles, main issue is the screen just isn't very bright, in string sun it's almost unusable which is something my G4 and G6 never had issues with. On the good side the camera is excellent at this price point, and overall it's a strong 7/10 but the competition is strong at this price so I'd definitely look at the Nokia and other some of the newer Chinese brands before blindly buying Motorola again.
customer_reviews.author: JayGee74

customer_reviews.title: Super phone at realistic money!
customer_reviews.text: I became a Motorola convert after being stung for very expensive phones in the past, I own the G6 and now the G8. The G8 screen looks great and the phone does everything I want without problem. One minor annoyance is the loss of a sim slot to use an SD card, the G^ had two sims and an SD card. Apart from that minor grumble excellent value imo!
customer_reviews.author: Mr P.Bromley

customer_reviews.title: Poor show
customer_reviews.text: This phone was advertised as "brand new", however it was clear at the beginning it was not. On start up some screen flashed up saying Tim? It was clear a third party had installed their own software? The charger in the box was not original and not a fast charger. Also there were screen problems such as being unresponsive. To be honest, if you pay full price you should receive brand new especially as it is advertised as such.
customer_reviews.author: Nezza

customer_reviews.title: Cheap rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Utterly appalling phone, at least three times a day it switched off, like a hard reset where I've got to put the pin in the reactivate the functions so I miss calls and texts if I haven't noticed it's done it. Apps conantly freeze and close, not responding message all the time. I said I wouldn't buy another Moto phone after the g7 power which apart from a battery was slow, particularly on the internet WiFi. I spent a bit more on the plus thinking the price would represent the performance. Wrong! This is the last time I buy from Lonovo
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, just too big
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it because I loved the Moto G6 Plus and this is similar but better in all respects, and has Wifi Calling compatible with my mobile network. I'm pleased with it in every respect apart from the fact that it is too big, and requires two hands to use.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Brought as an upgrade from my E4 plus. Lovely phone very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ginjaninja

customer_reviews.title: Good phone, updates uncertain.
customer_reviews.text: Good phone but no update to Android 10 yet, not sure I would buy Motorola again if they don't update. I may move back to one plus as they update regularly for some years. Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.author: J. Gornall

customer_reviews.title: Bang For Your Buck
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my girlfriend for Christmas. She's a legacy Moto G user. Her previous phone was a Moto G5. This is an obvious upgrade, but still maintains that familiar Moto G feel. You get a lot of phone for your cash. It's nippy, looks good and has excellent battery life. It's a cracking budget device.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Shilton

customer_reviews.title: Motorola G8 plus - fabulous.
customer_reviews.text: This phone takes great photos. It’s easy and responsive to use. When typing text, the auto suggestions re spelling etc are great. It looks smart and it is smart in so many ways. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jilly J

customer_reviews.title: Great value phone.
customer_reviews.text: What can you say the moto series continue to be good value phones. The finger print reader is better than the G6, screen is good and phone is responsive for general apps.
customer_reviews.author: Paulbb

customer_reviews.title: G8 Plus v G8 Power = G8 Plus.
customer_reviews.text: Worth paying £199 over the Moto G8 power. No bloatware, clean Android 9 operating system, good camera for price, excellent dual speaker sound system, good battery life, nice crisp display. Purchased for my wife who loves it. About to buy one for myself . . . for the right price.
customer_reviews.author: Garry Fry

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with my moto. Great value compared with samsung. Lot's of useful features as well as all the standard android stuff. Great screen and responsive fingerprint scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Falconetti

customer_reviews.title: Battery life (currently) nose dives for no reason.
customer_reviews.text: Great mid range phone but absolutely dismayed that the battery life is horrendous. Suspect we've wound up with bad cells or an update that's annihilating the CPU. Followed all online advice and made little or no odds. Going to give this phone a chance to see if the battery needs repeated cyclically topped up with a charge to get it holding more power for longer or not. Will update review in 7 days time with further impressions.
customer_reviews.author: J.Murray

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing camera.
customer_reviews.text: Battery is really good. Software is really clever. But Moto G4 has better camera and I bought this device thinking the camera was really good. Such a disappointment. I like photography and I think it is a shame that older device has better quality camera. Not fair.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanna

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th Motorola g i love them excellent value for money.never Had a problem with any of them.they keep getting better.
customer_reviews.author: Georgieboy

customer_reviews.title: Best phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: What a great phone for this price. No way there is anything better on the market at this price point. Fast, looks good, screen quality is great, battery life is very good. Can’t go wrong for the money
customer_reviews.author: Dean Clark

customer_reviews.title: Very solid phone
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the money. Good battery. Deecent but not perfect OS. Cant complain for £200. Camera decent as well. Also definitely has NFC - ordered from the UK for anyone confused as I was when ordering it!
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with the device
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Motorola phone since Moto G came into existence... Wish it still had split screen like motog4 plus, also wish it had a file explorer and less compulsory apps but all in all it is a great phone! Great budget category phone
customer_reviews.author: Ipsita Jena

customer_reviews.title: Hissing noise from ear piece
customer_reviews.text: I hear a hissing noise from the ear piece that varies in intensity from time to time. This is certainly not a network related issue, as I tested the sim with another phone and the call quality is absolutely fine. I had Motog previous models , but I repent buying this one. Camera is ok. Feels bulky and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: b p

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for money
customer_reviews.text: I love almost everything about the phone. My only dislike for now is the display quality. The colours levels is a bit on the warm side, giving the display a slight yellowish look especially when screen is dim.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Opene

customer_reviews.title: Great budget phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for the price. The screen is good quality and has good brightness. Dolby speakers are nice and loud, though lacking a bit of bass. Battery lasts well, quick charger is good. Camera performance is great and can shoot in RAW format if you want. Interface and Moto actions work well. Really pleased with it overall
customer_reviews.author: Nikola Petrovic

customer_reviews.title: Everyone out of battery? Not your phone! : )
customer_reviews.text: An excellent phone, easy to use, amazing battery life plenty of memory. My only issue is the finger print reader isn't great I've reset it several times and no improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Jammydoughnut

customer_reviews.title: Seems good so far
customer_reviews.text: From what little I know, this is a good phone of the price. The battery life is much better than with my old phone. At my level a use it can last two days on a single charge. And the fingerprint ready works fairly well. One of the main things I want from a phone is reliability, and I haven't had it long enough to judge that.
customer_reviews.author: Maths Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't feel like a budget phone, great battery life, great camera, NFC, turbo charge, colour is not great though, but for £240 it's brilliant. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Rolo

customer_reviews.title: Very good midprice phone...
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought this phone after long deliberations.Don't know why i waited! Superb definition,battery life immense, fingerprint reader sometimes takes a couple of goes to recognise,but that could be me! Only taken a couple of pictures but they look fine,selfiee camera miles better than my BlackBerry.All in all-WOW!
customer_reviews.author: mickeyd

customer_reviews.title: Great phone as always.
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for the price. Good screen, reasanoble camera and great battery life. Comes with a silicon case which feels a bit wonky, but still does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Borislav

customer_reviews.title: Like a Apple cracked (screen)
customer_reviews.text: Only had this for a few days and the screen cracked for no reason on a cold day! Good phone but cracked screen like most iPhones people have. Fragile so no good as a mobile phone ,sorry 2 stars only Moto.
customer_reviews.author: Whosphoto

customer_reviews.title: Seriously good phone at a good cost
customer_reviews.text: Amazing phone for the money! Fast & responsive, no issues at all. Battery life is brilliant, after a full days use I can have 30-40% battery life remaining. Excellent value, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A. R. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic phone
customer_reviews.text: I'm really pleased with my new phone. The screen is very clear and the sound quality for playing music is very good. I particularly like the fingerprint recognition as it makes logging into my accounts much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Potts

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent phone, having had way more expensive phones in the past, the G8 plus is every bit as good for a lot less money.!
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: Came to this from Samsung 9+ was bit wary but tbh I needn't of been. I use my phone quite basically.....social media, banking , apps and a few games etc and find it suits my use perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Helen w.

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: Fingerprint reader is less useful than on my previous G5 but overall a huge improvement now it is a 64Gb item here's hoping for a later model to get 128
customer_reviews.author: Scraggy

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: Had a Samsung s7 and decided to get a new phone. I didn't want to pay a fortune and decided on a moto g8 plus so far very happy
customer_reviews.author: Kev London

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Good product, easy to use, have NFC function, battery hold for up to 48h, great quality pictures, have my 2nd Motorola and I don't regret to swap it after using 10 years of Samsung
customer_reviews.author: Malgorzata

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing build.
customer_reviews.text: Returning as the glass covering the camera array is not bonded and lifts at one end. 48 hours old. I was lucky to spot it. Once bitten twice shy I'm afraid.
customer_reviews.author: talman

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money with lots of good features
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 12 year old who seems pleased with all its features. Equivalent to my more expensive Samsung!
customer_reviews.author: gruffalo

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this phone
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the phone. The battery life is great, I never come close to running out before I recharge at night. The stereo speakers are loud and sound good.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased with phone
customer_reviews.text: First Motorola phone for many years and I'm very impressed. Reasonable price for a quality phone. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic xx
customer_reviews.text: The battery is not too bad I get a day for using it and but everything else is fantastic condition xx
customer_reviews.author: Katelynn Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Best value android phone
customer_reviews.text: Good android phone. Good memory size expandable with SD card. Battery life excellent and recharges very quickly with the included turbo charger. Excellent value for money android phone!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs J Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Motorola G8 is a great buy
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with battery life and the fingerprint reader. The phone is so easy to use and screen size is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for those on a budget but still want a quality product
customer_reviews.text: Very good budget smartphone. Only issue I have is the default media player is useless and doesn't read my SD easily. Had to mess with the settings to get it to see all my music on it. Can't realistically expect any more from a device in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my uses
customer_reviews.text: I've had multiple android phones over the years and this phone is my best so far
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, price, service
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. Delivery was quick, very well packaged. Much cheaper than buying from the usual UK phon retailers
customer_reviews.author: CW123456

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, the right price.
customer_reviews.text: After using for four months I can confirm this phone is excellent, very good specs: screen, speed, camera, battery. I highly recommend this phone. Same specs iPhone will cost you three times as much.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant phone once you're used to fingerprint sensor
customer_reviews.text: Have had the motog5 6 and now 8 brilliant phone as usual not taken many photos lately due to coronavirus lockdown but looks good.The fingerprint sensor at the rear takes a bit of getting used to but gives more available screen.Definitely recommend for the money.
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing photo for usually good Moto brand
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Moto fan for years. I had the Moto 7 and was upgrading to this phone. I find it way slower than the 7, and constantly freezes and apps crash. None of these issued happened on the Moto 7! Very disappointed in this model.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Good battery life
customer_reviews.text: Perfect upgrade from the G4. Love the battery life .
customer_reviews.author: Mr G

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for money. Battery life is great, fingerprint reader is accurate , screen is nice and clear. Does everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: DavidS

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from a  g6 not disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Had a g6 got an upgrade to g8 plus love Moto's especially Moto actions. Good found plenty of memory. Only problem the you tube app crashes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff  Liverpool

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone with all the right features at a reasonable price compared to the market. Great battery life and screen resolution takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Dominc

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic phone, fantastic price! Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this phone! Always been an iPhone owner but got fed up with rubbish battery life after a while. This beauty turbo charges and lasts for ages compared! Great purchase! 😊
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good camera performance!
customer_reviews.text: The performance of the camera was better than expected. Fingerprint authentication is also speedy and I really like it. I use "Microsoft Launcher" and it is easy to use. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tomoki Shirakawa

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, great price. Buy one !
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier, it's a great phone. Easy to use and all the latest functions and user interfaces that make it quick and easy to use. Great battery life. No bugs so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Great phone at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Battery easily lasts a day with fairly heavy use. Feels nice in the hand and no performance issues so far (6 weeks of use).
customer_reviews.author: R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great and affordable phone
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and feel of the device and I am very impressed with the long lasting battery. Very good value for money.
